channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report E-2024090416
item.description:
Report E-2024090416

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-22T09:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-06
  • City: GROVE CITY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PITT OHIO EXPRESS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: During the process of loading freight into the trailer where the tote was already loaded, a protruding piece of wood from a broken pallet punctured the tote. The IBC container was immediately contained to reduce further release. The released material was neutralized, absorbed and containerized for proper disposal.

item.title: Report I-2024080047
item.description:
Report I-2024080047

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-22T09:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-09
  • City: JOPLIN
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: HARCROS CHEMICALS INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 1
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 151632
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: An unexpected medical condition caused our driver to loose consciousness while operating the vehicle which ended in a rollover. Additional hazardous materials spilled: UN3253, Disodium Trioxosilicate, 8, PG111, paper bag specs 5M2/Z26/S/23/USA/M6775, 10-50lb bags spilled totaling 500 lbs. UN3378, Sodium Carbonate Peroxyhydrate, 5.1, PGII, paper bag specs 5M2/Y27.0/S?23/USA+BR11981, 5-55Ib bags spilled totaling 27 lbs.

item.title: Report X-2024070285
item.description:
Report X-2024070285

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-21T00:40:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-17
  • City: MCRAE
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 45
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 50000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Car was found releasing vapor as it went through Beebe, AR and was stopped by the local FD outside McRae, AR. The FD conducted a 1/2-mile evacuation and isolated the area. Upon HMM arrival, we met with the FD and was granted approval to access the car. Upon inspection of the car, liquid was observed releasing from under the valve at the connection of the 4-bolt valve flange to the flanged riser due to all four nuts that secure the valve to the flange not secured. The four nuts were found inside the protective housing. The pressure was removed from the car, the leak stopped, and the four bolts properly secured. The car was neutralized and set out. An OTMA-1 was granted for movement back to the shipper.

item.title: Report E-2024090368
item.description:
Report E-2024090368

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-19T09:21:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-19
  • City: BALTIMORE
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG Energy, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8250
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver was pumping out the customer's storage tank and overfilled the tank trailer. This resulted in approximately 250 gallons of gasoline being released. Miller Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report E-2024090296
item.description:
Report E-2024090296

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-18T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-13
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG SPECIALTY PRODUCTS GROUP, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The KAG Specialty Products Group, LLC driver failed to properly secure the loading lines at the shipper location. As a result, approximately 1300 pounds of molten sulfur was released. Hepaco Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.
